data.name: Labarge Media
data.pros: Labarge is a small company that works with large and small clients alike. They work with several local businesses too. I feel that doing work in the community you live in is especially meaningful. Its located in the charming city of Canandaigua which is where I'd like to be someday.
data.cons: This is a small company thats very competative to get into. My lack of experience could put me at a disadvantage. But I feel like I can make up for that with good character and a strong work ethic.

data.name: Two Bulls
data.pros: Im interested in their work. On their website they talk about a few of the cool projects they are working on. My development experince with IOT devices would be benneficial to their team.
data.cons: The office I would likly be in is located in NYC. I would prefer not to work downstate.

data.name: Fitbit
data.pros: They seem to have a good work culture and provide many benfits to their employees. It would be cool to work on a product that is used by so many people.
data.cons: I prefer working in small teams. A company the size of fitbit is larger than I'd like. I'd prefer to stay in NY but Boston is beautful too.

data.name: Constellation Brands
data.pros: Constellation Brands is passionate about building brands that people love and helping them connect with one another. They work with many well established wine, beer, and spirit brands. They have a fun work culture and good work perks.
data.cons: They are looking for someone with 4+ years of experienece in front end dev. They build on the Angular framework where I prefer React. I would likely fall short for this position due to lack of experience.

data.name: Instrument
data.pros: Instrument is doing some really cool work. I saw them present at creative industry day in 2017 and they were very inspiring. They work with brands I know and love and have a great work culture. Portland OR seems like it is a fun place to live and work too!
data.cons: Several of the positions that are available here are senior level. I am lacking the experience for any of their current dev jobs.

data.name: Sharp Notions
data.pros: Sharp Notions is doing the kind of work I want to do, in a place I want to be. They are utilizing an array of modern technology to develop software and web apps for businesses large and small. Unlike several other positions I have found I meet the requirements and feel that this company could be a good fit.
data.cons: I dont have much experince with Docker, Android, Postgres, or .NET. Thankfully I am comfortable with the rest of their technology stack.

data.name: Partners & Napier
data.pros: They do amazing award winning work. They work with several big name brands. They are a local company with a great repuation and work culture.
data.cons: They focus very heavy on branding and marketing, more so in the cinematic space than the web. There are NO available positions. But they do have some design openings...

data.name: CGI Communications
data.pros: CGI has been on my radar for awhile. They are a one stop shop for marketing needs. They are located in downtown Rochester but have offices all around the country. Plus it looks like a fun place to work!
data.cons: My backend skills need to be strengthened to be considered a 'full stack' dev. There are some mixed reviews about working here. But id like to give it a go!

data.name: Dixon Schwabl
data.pros: Dixon Schwabl looks like an amazing place to work. Work culture and location are very important to me. They work with big and small brands alike. They are looking for New Media majors!
data.cons: The Digital Project Manager oversees all tactical aspects of assigned projects. This postion is more involved on the management side than I'd like to be. I would fall short on work experience since they want 5-7 years development and 3-5 years of project management skills.

data.name: clevermethod
data.pros: Clevermethod does work for serveral awesome brands. They seem to have a fun work culture and are doing projects that interest me.
data.cons: It's pretty close to Buffalo which means the winters would be especially hard, but nothing that Rochester hasn't conditioned me to handle.
